US economy posts terrible hiring number days out from election https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/us-economy-posts-terrible-hiring-number-days-out-from-election/UM4STSMKAVFHXN4WT7L72OLWCU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/us-economy-posts-terrible-hiring-number-days-out-from-election/UM4STSMKAVFHXN4WT7L72OLWCU/ Thomas CoughlanJobs data published this week came in at 12% of what economists expected. Sat, 02 Nov 2024 00:33:53 +0000 US Vice-President and Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris will face heavy criticism just days out from the US presidential election after the latest jobs data fell chronically short of expectations. Photo / AFP
Landlord Jack Biddle sent adult children to evict couple from Waikato rental property https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/landlord-jack-biddle-sent-adult-children-to-evict- Couple-from-waikato-rental-property/FIDV72BX2VGQRLGJ4U424WNE7Q/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/landlord-jack-biddle-sent-adult-children-to-evict- Couple-from-waikato-rental-property/FIDV72BX2VGQRLGJ4U424WNE7Q/ Catherine HuttonThe tenants felt they “had no rights and no choice” other than to leave that day. Sat, 02 Nov 2024 00:00:00 +0000 The Tenancy Tribunal found the landlord didn't give written notice or reasons for terminating the tenancy. Photo / 123rf
Hamilton child assaulted: Police seek dashcam footage after van driver grabs girl’s arm https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/hamilton-child-assaulted-police-seek-dashcam-footage-after-van-driver-grabs-girls-arm/I2KA4MGOZREIDNQWFCVXQ2ZXPA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/hamilton-child-assaulted-police-seek-dashcam-footage-after-van-driver-grabs-girls-arm/I2KA4MGOZREIDNQWFCVXQ2ZXPA/ Police appeal for information after victim left shaken by incident. Fri, 01 Nov 2024 23:54:06 +0000 Police are appealing to any witnesses or motorists with dashcams who saw a man attempt to grab a young girl in Silverdale, Hamilton, on Friday.
Fire in Auckland Central apartment building on Anzac Ave draws large response from firefighters https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/fire-in-auckland-central-apartment-building-on-anzac-ave-draws-large-response-from-firefighters/RXSLXV6V4JH3LEV7ELG7J6FR2Q/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/fire-in-auckland-central-apartment-building-on-anzac-ave-draws-large-response-from-firefighters/RXSLXV6V4JH3LEV7ELG7J6FR2Q/ Seven fire stations responded, sending six fire trucks and two ladder trucks. Fri, 01 Nov 2024 23:42:04 +0000 Fire and Emergency NZ was notified of the fire automatically by a fire alarm going off in a building on Anzac Ave about 11.17am. Photo / Sam Hurley
Community rugby sees increase in diversity with record number of female players https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/sport/community-rugby-sees-increase-in-diversity-with-record-number-of-female-players/DB64KTXWBJHE7ECQOO7WAWMENA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/sport/community-rugby-sees-increase-in-diversity-with-record-number-of-female-players/DB64KTXWBJHE7ECQOO7WAWMENA/ A record 33,757 women and girls play rugby, a 15% increase this season in NZ. Photo / David Hall

Group assault at Glen Innes train station: Teenagers allegedly run to police station for help https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/group-assault-at-glen-innes-train-station-teenagers-allegedly-run-to-police-station-for-help/K3SGWAIPF5FCJB6NEPYKUAYVXQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/group-assault-at-glen-innes-train-station-teenagers-allegedly-run-to-police-station-for-help/K3SGWAIPF5FCJB6NEPYKUAYVXQ/Two boys were pursued by the group through Glen Innes. Photo / Google

Drink driver Tere Moekore jailed for Auckland hit-and-run that killed Papatoetoe High School student Kaea Matau https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/drink-driver-tere-moekore-jailed-for-auckland-hit-and-run-that-killed-papatoetoe-high-school-student-kaea-马塔乌/HF5G3QXZLVGW7KJZFVHKRWIYRM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/drink-driver-tere-moekore-jailed-for-auckland-hit-and-run-that-killed-papatoetoe-high-school-student-kaea-马塔乌/HF5G3QXZLVGW7KJZFVHKRWIYRM/ Craig KapitanTere Moekore was four times over the limit when she hit Kaea Matau - and kept on driving. Fri, 01 Nov 2024 22:00:00 +0000 Kaea Matua, 14, was killed while crossing Great South Rd in Papatoetoe in March. He was hit by a car driven by Tere Moekore (inset), who was four times over the legal limit for alcohol on a learner's licence and travelling at 95km/h in a 50km/h zone. Photo / Alex Burton
